content: According to interviews with Beyoncé, "Lemonade" was inspired by various sources, including personal experiences of betrayal and infidelity in her relationship with husband Jay-Z, as well as broader themes related to the experiences of Black women in America, including themes of resilience, healing, and empowerment. Other sources of inspiration for the album included the poetry of Warsan Shire and the work of various visual artists and filmmakers.
